intro: Megalastrum longipilosum var. glabrescens, commonly known as the silky spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves that become smoother as the plant matures. The species produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is sometimes considered a weed in certain regions.
